Module contents¶

jaxparrow.cyclogeostrophy(u_geos: ndarray | MaskedArray, v_geos: ndarray | MaskedArray, dx_u: ndarray | MaskedArray, dx_v: ndarray | MaskedArray, dy_u: ndarray | MaskedArray, dy_v: ndarray | MaskedArray, coriolis_factor_u: ndarray | MaskedArray, coriolis_factor_v: ndarray | MaskedArray, method: Literal['variational', 'penven', 'ioannou'] = 'variational', n_it: int | None = None, lr: float = 0.005, res_eps: float = 0.0001, res_init: float | str = inf, res_filter_size: int = 3) → Tuple[ndarray | MaskedArray, ndarray | MaskedArray]¶

Computes velocities from cyclogeostrophic approximation using a variational (default) or iterative method.

Parameters:

  • u_geos (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – U geostrophic velocity value

  • v_geos (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – V geostrophic velocity value

  • dx_u (np.ndarray) – U spatial step along x

  • dx_v (np.ndarray) – V spatial step along x

  • dy_u (np.ndarray) – U spatial step along y

  • dy_v (np.ndarray) – V spatial step along y

  • coriolis_factor_u (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – U Coriolis factor

  • coriolis_factor_v (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – V Coriolis factor

  • method (Literal["variational", "penven", "ioannou"], optional) – numerical method to use, defaults to “variational”

  • n_it (int, optional) – maximum number of iterations, defaults to N_IT_IT

  • lr (float, optional) – gradient descent learning rate, defaults to LR_VAR

  • res_eps (float, optional) – residual tolerance: if residuals are smaller, we consider them as equal to 0, defaults to EPS_IT

  • res_init (float | str, optional) – residual initial value: if residuals are larger at the first iteration, we consider that the solution diverges. If equals to “same” (default) absolute values of the geostrophic velocities are used. Defaults to RES_INIT_IT

  • res_filter_size (int, optional) – size of the convolution filter (from Ioannou) used when computing the residuals, defaults to RES_FILTER_SIZE_IT

Returns:

U and V cyclogeostrophic velocities

Return type:

Tuple[Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray], Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]]

jaxparrow.geostrophy(ssh: ndarray | MaskedArray, dx_ssh: ndarray | MaskedArray, dy_ssh: ndarray | MaskedArray, coriolis_factor_u: ndarray | MaskedArray, coriolis_factor_v: ndarray | MaskedArray) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]¶

Computes the geostrophic balance

Parameters:

  • ssh (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – Sea Surface Height (SSH) value

  • dx_ssh (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – SSH spatial step along x

  • dy_ssh (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – SSH spatial step along y

  • coriolis_factor_u (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – U Coriolis factor

  • coriolis_factor_v (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – V Coriolis factor

Returns:

U and V geostrophic velocities

Return type:

Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]
